interlinear-text.item: ELA The King's son and the vizier's son

phrase.item: I am going to tell you a story about a king's son and vizier's son.
Once there was a king.
The king had a vizier.
[The king] grew up together with the vizier from childhood.
from childhood they grew up together, they studied and fought together,
Like that they grew together.
Most of the time they couldn't be without each other.
Later, they got married together at the same time.
After their wedding, some time passed and after nine months and nine days both of them had a son.
They were really happy together.
They both took their children to school.
They took them to the sheykh and the teacher. They were taught different skills and subjects.
So they reached at the age of 12.
Then the vizier told to the king: "Let's choose something for our children, something they can make great use of in their lives,
some skill, ability.
Then the king said, "I don't know!
Maybe we should teach them swordsmanship.
As the vizier was very smart he said, "No!
They can do swordplay.
They are the king and the vizier's sons.
When they go to the fighting, they will learn.
Let's teach them swimming.
In their lives, if they don't learn swimming, they won't be able to handle any problem.”
The king agreed and said, "Okay!"
‎‎Then they brought them a trainer.
They were taught swimming for two years.
After two years passed they learned swimming very well, nobody could surpass them.
At that time... their names were Farukh and Shorukh.
One day, without their parents’ permissions they went down by the river to swim.
Later, they lay down on the sand, Farukh fell asleep, the vizier's son that is, and the king's son Shorukh did not fall asleep.
He just watched the river.
Suddenly he noticed that there was a sanduq [wooden chest traditionally associated with weddings] on the water.
He didn't wake up Farukh.
At that time he went [jumped] into the water. He went and opened the sanduq, and he saw that there was a girl inside.
The girl was very delicate and beautiful.
At the moment of seeing her, he lost his mind. The girl was beautiful.
Then he lost consciousness.
The sanduq continued floating and kept going, but the young man stayed there.
Farukh suddenly woke up, rubbed his eyes and saw that Shorukh was not there.
Then [Farukh] called [Shorukh's] name, but there was only silence. Then he saw down at the waterside that [his friend] was fully sunk in it, so that only his arm was out of the water.
As only his arm was visible, [Farukh] entered the water and took him out.
When [the other] woke up, [Farukh]
asked him, "Hey brother, what happened to you?
How did you sink?
You swim very well, we learned swimming together.”
Then Shorukh told his story saying, "This is what happened and I didn't want to bother you!"
Then they returned home.
Shoruk could not forget the girl at all, and then he said to Farukh, "You should help me as a brother
We should go and find that girl.”
Farukh replied, "I agree, and I will also go with you.
I am not going to leave you.”
Then, without their parents knowing, they gathered their food to go and they left at night time.
Seven days and nights they kept going.
Their food was finished, and they didn't have anything to eat.
Then Shorukh said, "We are going to die now, so what should we do?"
Farukh said, "No, there is a camel with us.
Let's slaughter the camel.”
They slaughtered the [camel] and cooked it in the forest.
So, the [camel meat] was enough for them for seven days.
After seven days again, they didn't have anything to eat.
Yet they still couldn't find the girl.
They went to many cities and villages but she wasn't there.
Then in that forest they said [to each other], "We will stay here and are going to die.”
For several days they didn't have anything to eat.
Then they saw smoke coming out from somewhere.
They followed the smoke and found it, and there was a person cooking food in 40 cauldrons.
They were surprised, saying, "40 cauldrons, why so many?"
They went and found that the man was a fool.
Then they said to him, “Give us a cauldron of food that we can eat.”
The foolish man said, "No!"
We are 40 brothers, so and [I am] cooking 40 cauldrons of food.
Everyday each of us eats a cauldron of food.”
The two were surprised
and said. "We are very hungry.
Give us a cauldron of food. Before your brothers return, we will cook your food again.”
“Where are your brothers?" [they] asked.
"My brothers went hunting,” he replied.
“You cannot cook until they come, because it takes time.”
[The two friends] stayed there like that.
The fool asked them, “Why did you come here?
“This is a place of fools, besides us [fools] there is nobody around, no humans.” [The two friends] were surprised.
Then Shorukh told him all his story.
He said, "So this is my story and this is what happened to me.
Now, I am looking for that delicate girl".
Then [the man] smiled and said, "That delicate girl that you two are looking for is our sister.
She is very beautiful.
So many evils, fairies, people and fools were after her. Nobody could catch her.
Because we we have a condition.
If you fulfill that condition I will give you my sister.”
Later, his brothers returned from hunting. [The fool] was the youngest brother.
He told all of them the story,
saying, "These people here came to get our sister.”
[The brothers] said, “We have a kind of condition.”
The oldest brother spoke,
"Opposite us there is a giant sycamore.
The sycamore is gigantic.
You two now come individually, not together.
You should go pull out the sycamore by the root and and chop it into pieces, and using that [wood] cook a cauldron of food, and only one person [of you two] should eat that one cauldron food.
Shorukh went and
tried hard to pull up the sycamore. He was so nervous because of the girl that he couldn’t do it.
Then he said to Farukh, "You come".
Farukh went and pulled out the sycamore by its roots and cooked a meal, he wasn't really able to eat all the food, but he forced himself and finished it.
Then the fool said, "We do according to our promises.
I will give you my sister.”
They handed over their sister.
Then he told Farukh, "Take a good care of our sister".
Farukh replied, "No!
I am not going to marry your sister.
My brother is going to marry your sister.
We were born on the same day, so we are brothers.
He really loves your sister,
I don't like your sister.”
[The fool] said, "Well, that's up to you, I gave you my sister.”
\Shorukh then married the girl.
They kept walking on the way for several days and one day they really got tired and slept.
At that time, Shorukh and his wife fell asleep, but Farukh was awake.
Later, two sparrows came and sat on the top of the tree branch. One sparrow said to another one, "If any one of them is awake, they will hear our conversation.
Then the other sparrow started telling.
It said,"These [people’s] story is really a tragedy.
his father will kill him.
Because the one whom Shorukh married — the king himself was in love this girl.
He could never fulfill the condition.
The girl stayed in his mind.
Now when he hears this news, he will proceed to kill his son.”
Then the other sparrow asked: "Then what should we do in order to keep the the king's son alive?"
The other one replied, "Only the vizier's son can help him.
First, they will take half the road, and the king will send them a horse.
Before sending the horse, the king
put a nice saddle on and then poison it. When his son sits on it, he will die.
At that moment the vizier's son should cut the horse in the middle into two
so that the prince won't sit on it.”
[The sparrow] said, "Then they will go toward the house.
When they get close to the city gate, they will be offered milk and butter.
The prince should not drink that.
The vizier's son should drop it.
When they enter the house, at night time the king will pour poison on the bride's face.
Whenever his son kisses her, he will die.
At that moment the vizier's son should kiss her.
Then the prince will be saved.”
The vizier's son heard everything they were saying, heard everything.
Then the sparrow said, "Whoever [of these two] hears our conversation should not tell anyone. Otherwise he won't be able to do anything and will turn into a stone.
In the morning Farukh woke up.
Everyone returned to their houses and he [Farukh] didn't tell anything to Shorukh.
He hid his words.

When they were getting close to their houses, they were brought a horse, with the message. "The king has sent a horse to his son.” The king's son didn't get chance to sit on the horse and Farukh [cut] the horse into two pieces, and Shorukh got upset.
Then he said many things to him [Farukh].
Farukh were quiet.
When they got close to the gate, the ladies brought them milk and butter.
Shorukh was about to drink it and Farukh then poured it.
At that moment Shorukh got upset again.
But he didn't say anything bad, just saying,”Have you lost your mind?
It's the second time you have made this kind of mistake.
Are you not happy because I have been married to this girl?
If you aren't happy, why did you give her to me in the first place?”
Then they entered the gate, and that evening they held the wedding.
The wedding was celebrated happily and joyfully.
Then at night the king poured poison on the bride's face.
Farukh kept watching the king.
When it was bedtime, Farukh went and kissed the bride on her face.
Shorukh got angry [again] and said, "Why are you doing this to my wife?
You have no right to do so.”
[Shorukh] said: "Tell me the truth or I am going to kill you. What’s going on?"
‎‎[Farukh] said, "No!
I cannot tell you this story".
He said, "If you don't tell me, I will kill you".
He [Farukh] said, "Ok, I am not worried. Kill me".
‎‎He siad, "No!
You should tell me first and if you want me to kill you, I will do it after.”
Then Fatukh told the whole story, saying. "Like this it all happened.”
He finished telling the story, not getting a chance to say anything else and turned into a stone.
Then all the servants came and took the stone and threw it in the garden.
At the moment when the sparrows were talking, [one of them] asked, "So what needs to be done for the person who turned into a stone to turn human again?"

Another one said, "If Farukh helps Shorukh, Shorukh will have a son or daughter, it doesn't matter. When they have the child when [the child] is one year old, they should go and drop [the child’s] blood on top of the stone.
When blood comes out, the stone will become alive, the person's soul will get back to him.”
Shorukh lived with that girl happily.
They had a son.
He grew up gradually, day by day he grew up and and then turned one year old.
Then Shorukh's wife came to them and asked him, saying, "Let's take our son to Farukh. On the stone we will [cut] his throat a bit and then let Farukh come back to life.”
[Shorukh] said to his wife, "No, are you crazy?"
He is our child. Because of a man we should go and cut a child's throat?"
Then his wife said, "How can you speak like that about your brother? Don't you remember, he sacrificed his life for you.
He fulfilled the condition so that you could marry me.
Only he could handle it.
You shouldn't be ungrateful.
‎‎He said, "No!
I won't take my child there, I won't make my child's blood flow because of someone else.”
He said, "[Farukh] is the vizier's son".
Several days passed.
Then the lady said, "I want to eat meat.
You should go hunting and bring me meat.”
Shorux said, "Ok, for you and my son I will do anything.”
He went hunting.
After two days he returned from hunting.
His wife in those two days took her son and went next to the stone where Farukh was.
On top of the stone she cut her son's throat.
The blood dropped on the stone, but nothing happened, then she said, "We were told a lie, it didn't work.”
After a while, the stone started moving.
Shorukh's wife turned around and saw the stone kept moving and turned into a human, so Farukh became alive again.
When Farukh became alive, she took him to her house, made him food and hosted him.
When Shorukh returned from hunting, when he entered [saw] that Farukh was sitting and having food.
When he saw Farukh, he grew really happy.
He asked with surprise, "How did this happen?
Such a miracle!” His wife replied, "No miracle happened. When you went for hunting, I took my son there and took his blood [with a cut].
Then Shorukh had tears in his eyes and cried, he went and hugged Farukh, saying, “Dear brother, please forgive me.
I was very ungrateful [to you] and acted not like a man.
What you sacrificed for me I did not notice and accept.
However, you should give thanks to my wife.
At that moment, Farukh also held his brother [by the neck], saying, "I forgive you.
I am your brother and it is my duty to do everything for you.”
Then they all forgave each other,
including Farukh, in that family, in the kingdom.
The son became the king, instead of his father.
Farukh became his vizier.
It was the same, as when their fathers were the king and vizier, a good friendship, just the same they were very good friends.
Both the king and the vizier went everywhere together. they did everything together.
That's all!
